description:
With the kernel `inotify <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inotify>`__
feature, the `D-Bus mocker
library <https://launchpad.net/python-dbusmock>`__ and the `udev
monitoring <http://pyudev.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api/pyudev.html#pyudev.Monitor>`__
we try to detect the different events that occours when you're using a
specific set of connected devices.

Then we try to mimic these devices investigating also the kernel drivers
if necessary.

At the end we're ready to connect the simulation routines to our testing
procedure.
summary:
Do want to test the connection code to a wifi/gsm network, but you
haven't any dongle? Do you want to check your software notification when
the battery is low, but you're testing your application on your desktop?
Do you want to manipulate the data coming from a device, but you've lend
it to someone else? *No problem, you can emulate all these with Python!*
title: GNU/Linux Hardware Emulation with Python
